alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:12PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero, eastern Sierra and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Northrup Landing, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northrup Landing, White Sands National Monument and Holloman Air Force Base. This includes Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 198 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Southern Tularosa Basin
